member.name: T:Sidi.Forms.BROWSEINFO
member.summary: Contains parameters for the SHBrowseForFolder function and receives information about the folder selected by the user.

member.name: F:Sidi.Forms.BROWSEINFO.hWndOwner
member.summary: Handle to the owner window for the dialog box.

member.name: F:Sidi.Forms.BROWSEINFO.pIDLRoot
member.summary: Address of an ITEMIDLIST structure specifying the location of the root folder from which to browse. Only the specified folder and its subfolders appear in the dialog box. This member can be IntPtr.Zero; in that case, the namespace root (the desktop folder) is used.

member.name: F:Sidi.Forms.BROWSEINFO.pszDisplayName
member.summary: Address of a buffer to receive the display name of the folder selected by the user. The size of this buffer is assumed to be MAX_PATH bytes.

member.name: F:Sidi.Forms.BROWSEINFO.lpszTitle
member.summary: Address of a null-terminated string that is displayed above the tree view control in the dialog box. This string can be used to specify instructions to the user.

member.name: F:Sidi.Forms.BROWSEINFO.ulFlags
member.summary: Flags specifying the options for the dialog box.

member.name: F:Sidi.Forms.BROWSEINFO.lpfnCallback
member.summary: Address of an application-defined function that the dialog box calls when an event occurs. This member can be IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: F:Sidi.Forms.BROWSEINFO.lParam
member.summary: Application-defined value that the dialog box passes to the callback function, if one is specified.

member.name: F:Sidi.Forms.BROWSEINFO.iImage
member.summary: Variable to receive the image associated with the selected folder. The image is specified as an index to the system image list.

member.summary: Browse for directories.

member.summary: Browse for files and directories.

member.name: F:Sidi.Forms.BrowseForTypes.FileSystemAncestors
member.summary: Browse for file system ancestors (an ancestor is a subfolder that is beneath the root folder in the namespace hierarchy.).

member.name: M:Sidi.Forms.DirectoryDialog.lstrcat(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The lstrcat function appends one string to another.
member.param: Pointer to a null-terminated string. The buffer must be large enough to contain both strings.
Pointer to the null-terminated string to be appended to the string specified in the lpString1 parameter.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value is a pointer to the buffer.
If the function fails, the return value is IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: M:Sidi.Forms.DirectoryDialog.SHBrowseForFolder(Sidi.Forms.BROWSEINFO@)
member.summary: Displays a dialog box that enables the user to select a shell folder.
member.param: Address of a BROWSEINFO structure that contains information used to display the dialog box.
member.returns: Returns the address of an item identifier list that specifies the location of the selected folder relative to the root of the namespace. If the user chooses the Cancel button in the dialog box, the return value is IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: M:Sidi.Forms.DirectoryDialog.SHGetPathFromIDList(System.IntPtr,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Converts an item identifier list to a file system path.
member.param: Address of an item identifier list that specifies a file or directory location relative to the root of the namespace (the desktop).
Address of a buffer to receive the file system path. This buffer must be at least MAX_PATH characters in size.
member.returns: Returns a nonzero value if successful, or zero otherwise.

member.name: T:Sidi.CommandLine.TypeEx
member.summary: Extension methods for Type

member.name: T:Sidi.CommandLine.PersistentAttribute
member.summary: Properties marked with this attribute will be stored in the registry

member.name: T:Sidi.CommandLine.PasswordAttribute
member.summary: Properties marked with this attribute will not be displayed to the user

members.member:
Command line parser
Helps to transform your class into a command line application with attributes. You only have to decorate your class with [Usage("...")] attributes, and Parser will do the rest for you.
Supported argument types are: bool,int, double, string, DirectoryInfo, FileSystemInfo, DateTime, TimeSpan and enums. You can use System.ComponentModel.CategoryAttribute to sort your actions and options into categories to make the usage message more readable.

member.name: F:Sidi.CommandLine.Parser.preferencesPassword
member.summary: It is not safe to use an internal password to store secrets in the registry, but better than nothing, however.

member.name: M:Sidi.CommandLine.Parser.GetPreferencesKey(Sidi.CommandLine.Option)
member.summary: The registry key for an option is HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\[Company]\[Product]\[Full application class name]

member.name: M:Sidi.CommandLine.Parser.ShowUsage
member.summary: Writes usage information to the console.

member.name: M:Sidi.CommandLine.Parser.WriteUsage(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes usage information to a TextWriter
member.param: Receives the usage message.

member.name: P:Sidi.CommandLine.Parser.PreferencesKey
member.summary: Registry key for LoadPreferences and StorePreferences. Should be set to HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\[your company]\[your product] Default is HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Sidi.CommandLine.Parser
